title: Chicken Normandy
ingredients: 1 medium apple, peeled, cored and sliced
4 whole chicken breasts, skinned, boned and halved
instructions: Melt the butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat.  Add the apple and sugar and cook until the apple is just tender, 2 to 3 minutes.  Remove the apple slices with a slotted spoon and reserve.

Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until the chicken is golden brown, turning once, about 5 minutes.  Add the apple juice and brandy and reduce the heat to medium low.  Cover and continue cooking until the chicken is tender, about another 10 minutes.  When there is no more pink in the chicken remove it and set it aside.

Return the cooked apple to the skillet and add the cream.  Increase the heat to medium-high and stir until the mixture is slightly thickened, about 5 to 8 minutes.  Return the chicken to the skillet and spoon the sauce over the chicken, re-warming it, if necessary.
source: Too Busy to Cook, Bon Appétit Magazine, November 1984.
